Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • UserManager

  • public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The UserManager class is used when we need to get user info, create new user, or update existing user info It creates a connection from DatabaseDriver, and connects to LoginGUI
    Author:
    JasonZheng, AlexXia

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.sql.Connection userManagerConn 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserManager()
      Constructor for UserManager

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkUser(java.lang.String email)
      This method is for registration use, to check if the input email address has been used or not If there is already an entry with the email provided in the database, then return true
      boolean checkUser(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      This method is for login use Check if the user is an active user to login into the system by verifying the email and password
      void createUser(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String email, int roleID, java.lang.String department, int active, java.lang.String password)
      This method will create a new user and insert this user's info into database All the information will be pull from user input
      User getCurrentUser(java.lang.String email)
      This method returns a user object that associates with the input email.

    • Method Detail

      • checkUser

        public boolean checkUser(java.lang.String email,
                         java.lang.String password)
        This method is for login use Check if the user is an active user to login into the system by verifying the email and password
        Parameters:
        email - the input user email
        password - the input user password
        Returns:
        true/false - if the input matches data in the database or not

      • checkUser

        public boolean checkUser(java.lang.String email)
        This method is for registration use, to check if the input email address has been used or not If there is already an entry with the email provided in the database, then return true
        Parameters:
        email - the input user email
        Returns:
        true/false - if the input matches data in the database or not

      • createUser

        public void createUser(java.lang.String firstName,
                       java.lang.String lastName,
                       java.lang.String email,
                       int roleID,
                       java.lang.String department,
                       int active,
                       java.lang.String password)
        This method will create a new user and insert this user's info into database All the information will be pull from user input
        Parameters:
        firstName - first name of the user
        lastName - last name of the user
        email - email address of the user
        roleID - if user register, the role will be set as 1-requester
        department - department of the user
        active - when user register, it will be set as 1-active
        password - user password

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser(java.lang.String email)
        This method returns a user object that associates with the input email. It will only be called after the method checkUser.
        Parameters:
        email - user email address
        Returns:
        user a user object that associate with the input email
